page.title: 04Communications-Ballantrae.
page.content: Survey area mail service is covered by 2 established motorised postmen and an auxiliary village postwoman.Northern area delivered from Girvan and south by Ballantrae based postman.3 post boxes.Automatic exchange situated in village covers all telecommunications. Non-subscribers can use a telephone kiosk in Main St.3 licenced radio hams Some Citizen Band radio users serve useful communication contacts.Survey area receives TV programmes from north Ireland+BBC1 Scotland and Border from booster mast,sited above village.Usual radio programmes+West Sound and Downtown local radio are received. Interference caused by Portpatrick Coastal Radio Station.If roads are blocked in winter the sea provides outside contact per fishing boat conveying bread,meat and mail and stranded passengers.
